_decoded_content.title: When target fails, print last message output by tap that may have been the culprit
_decoded_content.description:
When running in debug mode (https://meltano.com/docs/command-line-interface.html#debugging), `meltano elt` already prints all messages output by the tap, which can help when debugging a failing loader since the last message output by the tap is likely to be the same message that was being parsed/handled when the error occurred.

When debug mode is _not_ enabled (in production for example), this doesn't help much, and a user would have to re-run a pipeline locally to find out what went wrong. Meltano can be helpful and always log the most recent message(s) output by the tap when the target fails.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description:
As a start, I think it would be good to prioritize based on:
- urgency of getting feedback
- relative implementation difficulty
- symbiotic relationships between issues

_decoded_content.title: Log warning when tap outputs invalid SCHEMA or RECORD message
_decoded_content.description:
For example: 
- a `SCHEMA` message with properties without a `type`/`anyOf`: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2485
- a `SCHEMA` message with multiple mutually incompatible types for one property: https://gitlab.com/meltano/tap-facebook/-/issues/7
- a `RECORD` message not matching the `SCHEMA` for the same stream

Some targets may handle be able to handle these misformed messages correctly by working around their lack of compliance with the Singer spec (https://github.com/singer-io/getting-started/blob/master/docs/SPEC.md#schema-message), but Meltano can log to aid in debugging when targets do fail.

Once we have https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2469, users will be able to work around these issues by manually providing a correct schema using https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#schema-extra. Of course, fixing the tap is still preferable, but bandaids have their use.

Message validation should be handled asynchronously and should not slow down throughput of messages from tap to target. We'll probably want a setting to opt-in/out.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description:
As a start, I think it would be good to prioritize based on:
- urgency of getting feedback
- relative implementation difficulty
- symbiotic relationships between issues

_decoded_content.title: Deselected stream properties are not always excluded from `SCHEMA` messages
_decoded_content.description:
The extractor `select` rules (https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#select-extra) are currently only applied to the generated catalog file, and it's up to taps to only include selected properties in their `RECORD` messages, which all taps do that support this feature, and their `SCHEMA` messages, which not all taps do: many just read the schema from the bundled copy even if not all properties were selected.

This means that when trying to fix an issue with a tap that emits a schema that is not supported by the used target (for example one with column names starting with numbers: https://gitlab.com/meltano/tap-facebook/-/issues/6), we cannot currently fix using the `select` extra.

_decoded_content.title: Extractor `schema` overrides are only applied to catalog, not tap's `SCHEMA` messages
_decoded_content.description:
The extractor schema override rules (https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#schema-extra) are currently only applied to the generated catalog file, and it's up to taps to use that same schema when emitting the `SCHEMA` message, which not all taps do: many just read the schema from the bundled copy even if it was overridden.

This means that when trying to fix an issue with a tap that emits a schema that is not supported by the used target (for example one claiming that a column can have multiple incompatible types: https://gitlab.com/meltano/tap-facebook/-/issues/7), we cannot currently fix this using the `schema` extra.

## Workaround using mappers (updated 2022-03-23)

Using stream maps capability, Meltano users can apply arbitrary inline expressions _between_ a tap and target. By utilitizing this capability, a user can _fully_ exclude a property from being delivered downstream.

While this feature is relatively new, we're actively looking for feedback on whether this works for the various scenarios where this issue occurs.

### Example

Assuming `tap-foobar` has a property called `data_blob` within a stream called `users`:

(Warning: below code not tested; may need small adjustments.)

```yaml
plugins:
  mappers:
  - name: meltano-map-transform
    # ...
    mappings:
    - name: remove-foobar-user-blob
      config:
        stream_maps:
          users:
            # Remove `data_blob` column from `users` stream, but leave everything else unchanged
            data_blob: null
  extractors:
  - name: tap-foobar
    # ...
  loaders:
  - name: target-snowflake
    # ...
```

Then this invocation should fully remove the `data_blob` field, in RECORD messages and also in the SCHEMA messages:

```console
meltano run tap-foobar remove-foobar-user-blob target-snowflake
```

Documentation links:

- Meltano docs regarding Mappers: https://docs.meltano.com/concepts/plugins#mappers
- Syntax guide for Stream maps: https://sdk.meltano.com/en/latest/stream_maps.html?highlight=stream%20maps

_decoded_content.title: Add option to `meltano elt` to dump generated catalog, state and config
_decoded_content.description:
Supersedes https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2290 and https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2288.

We can add a new `--dump` option with `catalog`, `state`, `extractor-config` and `loader-config` values.

_decoded_content.description:
Also:
- Installation path for debugging
- Installed version

_decoded_content.title: Singer runner does not log tap messages in debug mode
_decoded_content.description: When debugging a failing pipeline, often the stack trace is pretty vague. It's useful to know what messages the tap has emitted. However, running `meltano elt` with `--log-level=debug` does not print Singer messages.

_decoded_content.title: Publish JSON schema for `meltano.yml` on schemastore.org
_decoded_content.description:
This will add validation and autocompletion functionality to various editors: https://www.schemastore.org/json/#editors, https://json-schema-everywhere.github.io/yaml

_decoded_content.title: Prefix `meltano elt` log output with tap/target/dbt labels
_decoded_content.description: Users have had difficulty finding error messages in the long `meltano elt` output generated when a tap or target fails.

_decoded_content.title: Custom extractor did not show when the field "namespace" is mentioned in meltano.yml for model and transform.
_decoded_content.description:
Hi! I had a problem. After you answered me in this [issue](https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/issues/1811#notes), I created a brand new project to start from scratch. I was able to get data and the transform with worked well without error, but I'm not able to see my extractor in the integration list. ![image](/uploads/6cfb435b08f3e0a7c57f38de681ef63c/image.png)
This is my file meltano.yml: 

```
plugins:
  dashboards:
  - name: dashboard-gitlab
    pip_url: git+https://gitlab.com/meltano/dashboard-gitlab.git
  extractors:
  - label: GitLab
    name: tap-gitlab
    pip_url: git+https://gitlab.com/meltano/tap-gitlab.git
  - capabilities:
    - catalog
    - discover
    - properties
    - state
    executable: tap-github
    name: tap-github
    namespace: tap_github
    pip_url: git+https://github.com/L3houx/tap-github.git
    settings:
      - env: GITHUB_API_TOKEN
        name: access_token
      - env: GITHUB_REPO
        name: repository
  loaders:
  - label: PostgreSQL
    name: target-postgres
    pip_url: git+https://github.com/meltano/target-postgres.git
  models:
  - executable: model-github
    name: model-github
    namespace: tap_github
    pip_url: git+https://github.com/L3houx/model-github.git
  - name: model-gitlab
    pip_url: git+https://gitlab.com/meltano/model-gitlab.git
  orchestrators:
  - name: airflow
    pip_url: apache-airflow==1.10.2
  transformers:
  - name: dbt
    pip_url: dbt==0.14.4
  transforms:
  - name: tap-github
    namespace: tap_github
    pip_url: https://github.com/L3houx/test-dbt-tap-github.git
    vars:
      schema: '{{ env_var(''MELTANO_LOAD_SCHEMA'') }}'
  - name: tap-gitlab
    pip_url: https://gitlab.com/meltano/dbt-tap-gitlab.git
    vars:
      schema: '{{ env_var(''MELTANO_LOAD_SCHEMA'') }}'
      ultimate_license: '{{ env_var(''GITLAB_API_ULTIMATE_LICENSE'', False) }}'
project_id: 9eca27af-e383-4c1c-a385-d6695510d82f
schedules:
- extractor: tap-github
  interval: '@once'
  loader: target-postgres
  name: pipeline-1582833278348
  start_date: 2020-02-27 19:54:38.466076
  transform: run
send_anonymous_usage_stats: true
version: 1
```  
I did : `meltano install` and `meltano install --include-related` (like you said), but I wasn't able to see the Github custom extractor in the list. The way I did to see if the transform worked was by installing Gitlab extractor and change the name in the URL to github instead of gitlab but after that, I was unable to get models and create graphs. If I edit the HTML and enable the buttons to get models and create a graph but without editing the HTML I wasn't able.

![image](/uploads/14a5b348545c51901550be9d5dbba0af/image.png)

![image](/uploads/987b79ded9685e891f95b90f39f551d8/image.png)

![image](/uploads/d63206b2daa27e878fd7f5d529921feb/image.png)

I realize that when I add this section in meltano.yml
```
transforms:
  - name: tap-github
    namespace: tap_github
    pip_url: https://github.com/L3houx/test-dbt-tap-github.git
    vars:
      schema: '{{ env_var(''MELTANO_LOAD_SCHEMA'') }}'
```

or 

```
models:
  - name: model-github
    namespace: tap_github
    pip_url: git+https://github.com/L3houx/model-github.git
```

The extractor in the Integrations list disappear and when I remove the namespace section, it appears. I also tried with a custom model and I installed it with the namespace and it did not appear. Once a removed both namespace: tap-github (transform and model), the extractor appears in the list and I was able to use model. 

I'm not sure if it is easy to understand, if not, tell me and I will try to be as clear as possible. 

Thank you and have a nice day.
